post.summary: Deposit assets into this user's account from the outside world
post.description: Deposit assets into this user's account from the outside world. Note that this does not interact with any external systems; it simply adds the amount to the user's available balance in the ledger. Actual transfer of assets must be handled separately.

400.description: Bad request, e.g. invalid parameters or insufficient funds

post.summary: Withdraw assets from this user to the outside world
post.description: Withdraw assets from this user's account to the outside world. Note that this does not interact with any external systems; it simply deducts the amount from the user's available balance in the ledger. Actual transfer of assets must be handled separately.

400.description: Bad request, e.g. invalid parameters or insufficient funds

get.description: Opens a WebSocket stream for real-time asset price updates. First message contains all current prices, subsequent messages contain only changed prices. Data is sent as JSON objects keyed by asset ID.

apiKeyAuthHeader.description: API Key should be provided in the 'Authorization' header as 'ApiKey {your-api-key}'
apiKeyAuthHeader.name: Authorization

apiKeyAuthQuery.description: API Key should be provided as a query parameter 'x-api-key' for streaming endpoints
apiKeyAuthQuery.name: x-api-key

payments_every.description: Coupon payment frequency in nanoseconds (minimum 1000 i.e. 1 microsecond)

process_every.description: Number of nanoseconds to wait between coupon payment processing, must be at least 1000 (1 microsecond)

timezone.description: User's timezone, e.g., 'America/New_York', or an offset.
User's timezone, e.g., 'America/New_York', or an offset.

UpdateUserConfigRequest.description: Request body for PUT /user/{id}/config: update a user changeable details only. Other properties can only be changed by an admin following a manual request by the user.

photo_url.description: Optional: URL of the user's profile photo, optional.

timezone.description: User's timezone, e.g., 'America/New_York', or an offset.

show_tutorial_cards.description: Optional: Whether to show the tutorial.

notifications_enabled.description: Optional: Whether to show the notifications.

CreateOrUpdateUserResponse.description: Response body for POST /user or PUT /user/{id}: contains the ID of the created or updated user.

id.description: The ID of the created or updated user.

UpdateFieldString.description: A generic struct to handle optional updates for string fields in user requests.

value.description: The new value to set for the field.

UpdateRolesString.description: A generic struct to handle optional updates for roles fields in user requests.

value.description: The new value to set for the field.

UpdateFieldBoolean.description: A generic struct to handle optional updates for boolean fields in user requests.

value.description: The new value to set for the field.

original_price.description: If Kind is LIMIT, this is the original limit price. If Kind is MARKET, this may be 0 or omitted.

cancelled_quantity.description: Quantity that was cancelled, if any.

open_quantity.description: Quantity that is still open, i.e., not filled or cancelled.

original_quantity.description: The original quantity of the order when it was created.

filled_quantity.description: Quantity that has been filled so far.

filled_notional.description: Quote quantity that has been filled so far.

from_global_position.description: use global position for the order or isolated. required.

order_book_id.description: Required: the order book to submit the order to

tick.description: Minimum tradable increment for the selected order book

price.description: If kind is LIMIT, must be > 0; if MARKET it must be 0 or omitted

user_balance.description: User balance used to ensure they can afford the requested quantity

position_assets.description: Full list of assets in the position with their price and collateral weight, required when inverse_leverage < 1 for leverage health checks

assets_config.description: Configuration for the assets in the order

price.description:
if an asset is a CURRENCY, set 1 USD price,If an asset is a BOND and the price isn't found, set to 0 USD 
 You can find price details on /price/asset/{asset_id} route

last_price.description: Price of the most recent executed trade.

high_24h.description: Highest price of the orderbook in the last 24 hours.

low_24h.description: Lowest price of the orderbook in the last 24 hours.

change_24h.description: Change in price of the orderbook in the last 24 hours.

change_pct_24h.description: Change percentage in price of the orderbook in the last 24 hours.

volume_24h_base.description: Total volume of the orderbook in the last 24 hours.

volume_24h_usd.description: Total volume of the orderbook in the last 24 hours in USD.

id.description: The unique identifier for the position. Used, for example, when creating an order from a position, or deciding collateral should be transferred from position A to position B.

available.description: The available balance in the position for this asset that are not locked, supplied, or used as collateral

locked.description: The balance that has been reserved for a current order. If spent by the order, they are removed. If the order is cancelled, they are returned to the position's available balance.

supplied.description: The balance that user has supplied to the leverage module. The user remains entitled to these assets and can withdraw them into their available balance.

borrowed.description: The total amount of debt outstanding for this position. This position cannot be closed until all debt is fully repaid, i.e. borrowed = 0.

impending_borrows.description: The equivalent of locked balances, but for leveraged orders. If a user has an active order that would borrow assets as part of its input, then their borrow limit must be reduced until the order is executed or cancelled.

avg_entry_price.description: average cost per unit quantity that was paid (long positions) or received (short positions) for this asset.

gained.description: Assets that have been gained by stablecoin equivalence transformations. They cannot be withdrawn from the platform until converted back to the original asset.

lost.description: Assets that have been lost by stablecoin equivalence transformations. They can be recovered by converting back any assets gained by stablecoin equivalence transformations.

balances.description: A map of asset IDs to their module balances

available.description: The available balance in the module for this asset

supplied.description: The total amount supplied to the module for this asset

virtual.description: Assets minted by virtual-borrowing, but not yet repaid

borrowed.description: The total amount borrowed from the supplied but not yet repaid

data.description: The response data. Present for successful (2xx) responses.

error.description: The error message. Present for error (non-2xx) responses.

metadata.description: Metadata about the response, including status code and trace information.

ResponseEnvelope.description: Standard response envelope. For 2xx responses, 'data' is set. For errors, 'error' is set.

Time.description: The timestamp when the data was created

status_code.description: HTTP status code for the response.

request_id.description: Request ID for correlating logs and debugging.

Metadata.description: Metadata about the response, including status code and tracing information.

aggressor_indicator.description: If true, then this order is the aggressor (taker); otherwise it is the maker.

StreamAssetPricesResponse.description: Map of asset prices keyed by asset ID. Format: {"asset_id": {"asset_id": "uuid", "price": "decimal", "time": "date-time"}}

order_book_id.description: The ID of the order book.

base_quantity.description: The quantity of the base asset.

quote_quantity.description: The quantity of the quote asset.

bids.description: sorted in desc order by price

asks.description: sorted in asc order by price

position_id.description: The ID of the position account

position_name.description: The name of the position account

is_global.description: Whether the position account is the global or an isolated account

expires.description: Date at which the api-key will expire

available.description: The total margin available from this position.

used.description: The amount of margin used from this position.

remaining.description: The margin remaining available from this position.

side.description: The side of the position (LONG or SHORT)

avg_entry_price.description: The average entry price of the position

mark_price.description: The current mark price for the asset to calculate daily PL. This is usually the close price of the previous day

liquidation_price.description: The liquidation price of the position

available.description: The available quantity in units of the asset

borrowed.description: The borrowed quantity in units of the asset

unrealized_pl.description: The unrealized profit or loss of the position

leverage_limit.description: The leverage limit for the position

tp.description: The take profit price set for the position, if any

sl.description: The stop loss price set for the position, if any

initial_capital.description: The initial capital of the position

impending_borrows.description: The impending borrows of the position

locked.description: The locked amount of the position

unused_collateral.description: The unused collateral of the position

leverage.description: The leverage used to obtain the position on the isolated account

account_id.description: The ID of the account holding the position

account_name.description: The name of the account holding the position

is_global.description: Whether the account is the global or an isolated account
